content.question: The population of a certain species of insect is given by a differentiable function <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="P of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of insects in the population, in millions, at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in days. When the environmental conditions are right, the population increases with respect to time at a rate that is directly proportional to the population. Starting August 15, the conditions were favorable and the population began increasing. On August 20, five days later, there were an estimated 10 million insects and the population was increasing at a rate of 2 million insects per day. Which of the following is a differential equation that models this situation?

choices.label: <math alttext="P equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, t minus 5, close parenthesis, plus 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, two fifths t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, one fifth P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 5 P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, one fifth P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
